hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: How long have you lived here? imipramine food interactions Of course you want your mum to be healthy but the one thing that will not help your mother’s heart rate is having a daughter tutting every time the biscuit tin comes out or another spoonful of mash gets served. An unhealthy lifestyle is just as much a habit as a healthy one is, but the person needs to want to change. Your mum will find a way to avoid exercise and shovel calories down her throat unless she sees the problem and resolves to improve things. Has she been to the doctor? What’s her blood pressure? Does she have high cholesterol? A stern talking to by a health professional might give her the motivation she needs. Why don’t you offer to cook a couple of nights a week? Don’t go crazy – don’t kick off with tofu and quinoa – but maybe try some fish and rice or fruit for dessert. When it comes to exercise, you could ask her out to walk with you or, and this is a major step, get her a dog that needs to be taken out a few times a day. Just knowing you are concerned for her health might be enough to make her change her ways a little.
